item.title: Sandhya theatre tragedy: Case registered against 6 for pelting stones, vandalising Allu Arjun's residence - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sandhya Theatre Tragedy: Case Filed Against Six for Vandalism at Allu Arjun's Home

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the registration of a case against six members of the Osmania University Joint Action Committee (OU-JAC) for their involvement in a vandalism incident at actor Allu Arjun's residence, stemming from tensions related to the Sandhya Theatre tragedy.

  • A case has been filed against six individuals for allegedly vandalizing Allu Arjun's home.
  • The incident occurred after a protest outside his residence where stones were thrown.
  • Police have taken the accused into custody for their actions during the protest.
  • Allu Arjun expressed regret over the recent tragedy and denied any wrongdoing.
  • The protest arose from a clash of interests regarding the late premiere of his film, Pushpa 2: The Rule.
“This is deeply distressing for me.” - Allu Arjun

The unfolding events have brought significant public attention, highlighting issues of safety and crowd management during film promotions.

item.title: Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 18 Ticket Sales: Allu Arjun Beasts With 44% More Sold Tix Than Stree 2 On 3rd Sunday! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 18 Ticket Sales: Allu Arjun Beasts With 44% More Sold Tix Than Stree 2 On 3rd Sunday!

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: Koimoi

Pushpa 2 continues to dominate the box office with impressive ticket sales over its third weekend, showcasing its resilience against competing films.

  • On the 3rd Sunday, Pushpa 2 achieved approximately 440K ticket sales.
  • This is about 44% more than the 305K ticket sales registered by Stree 2 on the same day.
  • The peak sales rate reached 37K tickets sold per hour.
  • Total ticket sales for Pushpa 2 have reached impressive numbers over its run.
“It would be interesting to see where Pushpa 2’s journey ends with its ticket sales on BMS, setting a new record for the upcoming films!”

Overall, Pushpa 2 demonstrates extraordinary box office potential as it continues to break records and capture audience attention.

item.title: Alisha Parveen reacts to rumours of Rupali Ganguly being reason behind her ouster from Anupamaa: ‘Maybe yes..’ - India Forums
item.description:
Alisha Parveen reacts to rumours of Rupali Ganguly being reason behind her ouster from Anupamaa: ‘Maybe yes..’

Published: Sunday, December 22, 2024 at 6:37 PM

In an exclusive interview, Alisha Parveen discussed her sudden replacement from the popular show Anupamaa, revealing her feelings about the change and the experiences she garnered during her short time on the show.

  • Alisha was replaced on December 20, 2024, after only two and a half months of being on the show.
  • She expressed surprise at her abrupt dismissal, stating that she had not been informed prior to the meeting where she was replaced.
  • Rumors linking Rupali Ganguly to her replacement have circulated, with Alisha responding ambiguously, saying, 'Maybe yes, maybe no.'
  • Alisha emphasized that she shared a professional bond with Rupali and did not delve into personal matters.
“I did not expect so much love from people in such a less time. Ab khatam hogaya toh is chiz k liye bura lagraha hai.” - Alisha Parveen

Alisha's experience reflects the unpredictable nature of the television industry, where actors often face unexpected changes in their roles.

item.title: Bigg Boss 18: Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra get eliminated; Kashish Kapoor break down into tears saying ' - The Times of India
item.description:
Bigg Boss 18: Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra get eliminated; Kashish Kapoor break down into tears saying 'Everybody is a snake here'

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The latest episode of Bigg Boss 18 sees emotional exits as Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra are eliminated from the show, while fellow contestant Kashish Kapoor expresses deep sadness, declaring, 'Everybody is a snake here.'

  • Edin Rose and Yamini Malhotra were voted out in the latest episode.
  • Kashish Kapoor broke down in tears, feeling betrayed by fellow contestants.
  • The episode highlighted the growing tensions among the housemates.
  • Viewers are reacting strongly on social media, discussing the dynamics of the show.
'Everybody is a snake here' - Kashish Kapoor expressing her feelings on the elimination.

This episode has stirred up significant discussions among fans regarding the friendships and alliances in Bigg Boss 18.

item.title: Is Bhavika Sharma planning to quit Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin post leap? Here’s what she has to say - Bollywood Life
item.description:
Bhavika Sharma Addresses Rumors of Quitting Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin Post Leap

Published: December 22, 2024 10:45 PM IST | Source: Bollywood Life

Introduction

Bhavika Sharma reacts to rumors regarding her potential exit from the popular show Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin following an upcoming generation leap.

Key Points

  • Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin has been a top show since its launch in 2020.
  • The series is rumored to take another leap where current cast members, including Bhavika Sharma and Hitesh Bharadwaj, will leave.
  • Audience dissatisfaction with plot similarities to another show caused a drop in ratings.
  • Bhavika stated that she learned about the potential changes from the media and that no official announcements have been made to the cast.

Notable Quotes

“I have read the news and came to know about this through media only. We have absolutely no clue about this.” - Bhavika Sharma

Conclusion

The future of Ghum Hai Kisikey Pyaar Meiin remains uncertain as viewers await confirmation on the rumored cast changes and storyline developments.

item.title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18: Allu Arjun house vandalised over stampede case even as film makes ₹1063 crore - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 18: Protesters vandalised Allu Arjun's Hyderabad house

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the impressive box office performance of Pushpa 2 while highlighting the vandalism of Allu Arjun's house due to ongoing issues related to a stampede incident.

  • Pushpa 2 has grossed approximately ₹1063.64 crore net in India by the 18th day of its release.
  • The film collected ₹33.99 crore on its third Saturday, showing strong performance.
  • Allu Arjun's house was vandalized by protesters related to the stampede case that occurred during the film's premiere.
  • The actor has expressed his condolences and pledged financial assistance to the victim's family.
“Everyone has seen what happened at our house today. But it is time for us to act accordingly.” - Allu Arjuna's father

The incident raises concerns over fan conduct at film events and the implications on public safety.

item.title: After Mukesh Khanna, Kumar Vishwas takes a dig at Shatrughan Sinha and Sonakshi Sinha: 'Aapke ghar ka naa - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Kumar Vishwas Critiques Shatrughan and Sonakshi Sinha

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Kumar Vishwas has taken a jab at Shatrughan Sinha and Sonakshi Sinha, pointing out the irony of their family name while addressing the notion of domestic matters.

  • Vishwas highlighted the contradiction in their family's traditional values and current situation.
  • His statement alludes to a broader commentary on family respect and values.
  • This critique comes amid ongoing discussions regarding celebrity accountability.
“Aapke ghar ka naam to Ramayan ho aur aapke ghar ki Shree Lakshmi ko koi aur uthakar le jaye.”

This incident underscores the tension between public personas and private lives among celebrities.

item.title: What Happened Between Blake Lively And Justin Baldoni? A Full Breakdown Of The 'It Ends With Us' Feud - News18
item.description:
What Happened Between Blake Lively And Justin Baldoni? A Full Breakdown Of The 'It Ends With Us' Feud

Publication Date: December 22, 2024 | Source: News18

The article discusses the legal battle between Blake Lively and Justin Baldoni, stemming from allegations of sexual harassment and a toxic working environment during the filming of 'It Ends With Us.'

  • Blake Lively filed a lawsuit against Justin Baldoni in December 2024, alleging sexual harassment and retaliation.
  • Despite the film's success, reports surfaced of on-set tensions and personal grievances between the two actors.
  • Allegations include unwanted physical contact and inappropriate discussions by Baldoni.
  • Lively claims there was a smear campaign initiated against her following her complaints.
  • Colleen Hoover, the novel's author, expressed support for Lively, while Baldoni's legal team denied all allegations.
  • Baldoni has reportedly been dropped by his talent agency following the lawsuit.
“I hope that my legal action helps pull back the curtain on these sinister retaliatory tactics… and helps protect others who may be targeted.” - Blake Lively

The allegations have sparked significant public interest and debate regarding workplace conduct in the film industry.

item.title: Allu Arjun's father talks about their Hyderabad home being vandalised over Pushpa 2 stampede case - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vandalism at Allu Arjun's Home After Pushpa 2 Incident

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Allu Arjun's father, Allu Aravind, addressed the press after protesters vandalized their Hyderabad home, demanding money for a victim of a recent stampede at a film event. The police have arrested the offenders and are prepared for further actions.

  • The incident occurred due to demands related to a stampede at a film event promoting Pushpa 2.
  • Protesters vandalized the property, breaking flower pots and pelting tomatoes.
  • Allu Arjun stated he was unaware of the woman’s death until the next day after the event.
“Everyone has seen what happened at our house today. But it is time for us to act accordingly. Now is not the right time for us to react to anything.” - Allu Aravind

In conclusion, the incident underscores the intense pressure facing celebrities following tragic events and the public's expectation for accountability.
